summary: Donald Trump claimed during the Trump Paris Climate event on June 1st, 2017, that the United States will cease all implementation of the nonbinding Paris accord due to the disadvantages it poses to the country. He argued that the agreement benefits other countries at the expense of American workers and taxpayers, resulting in lost jobs, lower wages, shuttered factories, and diminished economic production. Trump also stated that compliance with the accord could lead to the loss of 2.7 million jobs by 2025, including 440,000 manufacturing jobs. He emphasized the negative impact on vital American industries such as automobile and coal, with production cuts projected for sectors like paper, cement, iron and steel, coal, and natural gas.
